title: Clashes erupt in West Bank as Israel strikes back at Gaza rocket fire â the day's events | World news | The Guardian
summary: protests erupt in the west bank .
more than 18 rockets fired from gaza , israel says .
two israelis injured by mortar shrapnel .
idf confirms retaliatory strikes on gaza .
israel orders response to gaza rockets .
reports of explosion in gaza city .

text: we 're going to wrap our coverage for the day , with major developments as follow .
israel and gaza militants resumed cross-border attacks after a three-day ceasefire expired .
more than 50 rockets were fired towards israel , according to the idf , which also says it hit 47 targets in gaza .
israel intensified strikes as night fell .
five gazans have been killed since attacks resumed , and 31 wounded .
the dead include at least one child , aged 10 , killed during a strike on the backyard of a mosque .
the un says that since the conflict began , 1,922 palestinians have died of whom 1,407 are believed to be civilians , including 448 children .
a rocket fired by militants in gaza hit the sdot negev regional council and injured a civilian moderately and a soldier lightly , according to israeli authorities .
sixty-seven israelis have been killed since the four-week war began , including three civilians .
talks in egypt stalled in an atmosphere of mutual recrimination ; a hamas spokesman said parties are not even close to a peace deal .
egypt , the un and us called on a return to the temporary ceasefire .
the israeli delegation left cairo and did not indicate whether it will return .
protests around west bank cities and borders clashed violently with israeli forces , with one palestinian shot dead and dozens wounded .
hundreds of palestinians marched and threw rocks at border guards , who broke up the protest with riot dispersal means .
nearly 250,000 people have fled to un shelters in gaza , according to the un , and some 65,000 estimated homeless .
hamas remains far from cowed , the guardian 's jason burke reports , even though it has fired a huge number of rockets and fought large battles with the idf .
jodi rudoren and fares akram have a stark , graphic report for the new york times on the death of 10-year-old ibrahim dawawsa , who was killed by a drone missile friday .
what shall i say ?
it was only a few minutes after he went out , [ his mother ] , 37 , wailed as she clutched a of her son at 5-years-old .
it was only minutes , only minutes .
at the site , men and boys pointed up at the place where the missile had shaved off a concrete pylon and sundered the wooden scaffold before , apparently , hitting ibrahim in the head .
they had found several pieces of jagged-edge metal shrapnel .

the neighborhood leader , nasser abu raid al-ghoul , 60 , said he [ and ] about 30 men in the temporary mosque nearby ¦ first saw two injured boys , and 10 minutes later found ibrahim 's bloodied head under the debris .

aid worker and human rights activist issam sammour conveys a dark , hopeless mood among palestinians in gaza : issam sammour ( @ issamsammour ) a friend of mine wo n't leave his home due to airstrikes continue , he said we will die in our house no safe place in # gaza rt
ceasefire , ceasefire , it does n't make any difference ¦ we are waiting for our team in cairo to get us some positive improvement but if there is nothing we can continue the fight .
a 40-year-old palestinian tells the guardian 's jason burke ( @ burke jason ) in gaza .
people in gaza expressed almost unanimous support for the decision to return to hostilities on friday , despite the deaths of about 1,800 people , mainly civilians .
many , though , are undoubtedly afraid to criticise the group openly .
around thirty children played and five adults slumbered through the hot hours of the afternoon in the basement of another overcrowded , crumbling building .
eighteen of the children , including 11 boys , are now orphans and homeless .

hamed admitted that one of his sons , 38-year-old hafiz , had held a senior rank in palestinian islamic jihad , perhaps the only faction to lose a significant number of senior commanders in the conflict so far .
what do you think these boys will do when they become men ?
hamed asked .
of course this will push these children to join the resistance .
if someone kills your father do you leave him alone ?
you can read the full piece here .

documents.title: strikes on gaza intensify
text: israel has again renewed its heavy bombardment of rafah and khan younis , journalist mohammed omer and human rights activist issam sammour report , both in gaza .
since the conflict began , the idf has followed a pattern of massive rounds of air strikes and naval shelling into the night , with intermittent lulls during the day .
mohammed omer ï£ ¿ ( @ mogaza ) rafah is being bombed now by airstrikes issam sammour ( @ issamsammour ) a huge explosion nearby
hamas is far from disabled after weeks of fighting , reports the guardian 's jason burke ( @ burke jason ) from gaza .
he describes hamas ' resilience despite evidence of heavy losses and israel 's powerful military .
most of the casualties were from anti-tank missile cells or lost on motorbikes .
these were low-level guys bouncing between missile positions , particularly in border areas , said daniel nisman , an israeli security analyst .
khaleel habeel , an islamic jihad official in gaza , admitted casualties , saying that if you take on the fourth most powerful army in the world then of course you lose people .
ziad abu oda of the mujahideen faction splinter group told the guardian that his organisation had lost 50 men , including fighters and political officials .

but even top-end estimates of casualties would be a fraction of the strength of hamas 's military brigades and other groups , which are believed to have 10,000 fighters permanently under arms , with another 10,000 in reserve .
burke also reports that hamas ' intensity has surprised israeli commanders , and has been deploying powerful sniper rifles , using tunnels and implementing a range of new tactics .

in khuzaar , a border village badly damaged in intensive fighting , another father , who did not want to be named , described how his son and six other local men had hidden in khuzaar to ambush israeli troops .
all seven were killed .

hamas , which was founded by islamist ideologues in gaza more than 25 years ago and is linked to the muslim brotherhood movement , has run orphanages , clinics , schools and youth activities through its social wing .
these aim both to recruit for the military brigades and consolidate the group 's broader support base in gaza .
the aims of the political wing too are subordinate to those of the organisation .
if it is a choice between government and the movement , the movement is always the priority , said omar shaban , a gaza-based analyst .
you can read the full piece here .

the overall count of palestinians killed is not in dispute , but the un , israel , gaza and human rights groups have made very different assessments of civilians versus combatants killed , ap reports : the un 's overall number of 1,922 killed is slightly higher than that of the gaza health ministry .
the un said nearly 73 % of the total , or 1,407 , were civilians , defined as those who did n't take part in hostilities and were not members of armed groups .
the un and human rights groups rely on witness accounts and community contacts of field researchers to distinguish civilians from combatants .
mahmoud aburahma of the al-mezan center for human rights said his researchers require at least two sources and count on their local ties to determine if someone was a combatant or civilian .

a senior idf commander says at least 50 % were ¦ members of the hamas terrorist movement , and israel maintains that it has exercised great restraint , blaming hamas for firing rockets from crowded residential areas .
critics counter that the sheer density of gaza 's population makes civilians vulnerable , regardless of hamas ' behavior .
the ap report continues : brigadier general mickey adelstein , a senior israeli army commander , said the number of dead militants was being underreported .
in one set of 300 names classified as civilians at least 50 % were members of the hamas terrorist movement , he said , declining to give further details on exactly who made that classification .
adelstein did not provide israel 's definition of a hamas member .
the movement has both a political and a military wing , along with thousands of civil servants who worked in the outgoing hamas government in gaza .
the gaza ministry of health also works to identify casualties , and its keeper of statistics , ashraf al-kidra , has a count that largely accords with human rights groups ' .
al-kidra keeps a running log , and speaks with witnesses and reporters .
on friday , his overall toll since 8 july stood at 1,902 dead , including at least 450 children and 243 women .
al-kidra uses a very broad definition of civilians , saying the term applies to anyone who has not been claimed by one of the armed groups as a member .

the israeli group b'tselem has adopted a slow , conservative approach , and has not finished its overall count : putting women , children and men over 60-years-old at a total of 615 people out of the 1,510 dead it as counted so far in the civilian category for now .
militant group islamic jihad announced a total of 43 deaths , and hamas has remained silent about casualties since the conflict began four weeks ago .
scenes of ruin , flight and shelter in gaza .
a palestinian in the remains of his living room shortly after his home was hit by an israeli air strike in the zaitun neighbourhood .
weiken/epa a palestinian removes belongings after what witnesses said was an israeli air strike on his house , in jabaliya refugee camp in the northern gaza strip .
salem/reuters children play on the floor of a classroom in a united nations-run school hosting internally displaced palestinians , in gaza city .
modola/reuters

hamas is open to all options and a desperate bid to end hostilities continues , the guardian 's jason burke ( @ burke jason ) and patrick kingsley ( @ patrickkingsley ) report from gaza city and cairo , respectively .
sami al-zohri , the hamas spokesman in gaza , told the guardian that hamas was open to all options .
we want a peaceful resolution to the conflict .
the problems are on the israeli side .
they have rejected all our demands , al-zohri said .
he added that there had been no discussions with the egyptians over opening the rafah border between gaza and egypt , where movement has been tightly restricted in recent years .
negotiations continued despite the violence .
azzam al-ahmed , the head of the palestinian negotiating team in cairo , which contains members of all the major palestinian factions , said the team wanted to continue the talks .
we will continue through our egyptian brothers to negotiate , to reach a final agreement that would return the rights [ of the palestinians ] , al-ahmed said .

we 've notified the egyptians that we 're here , whether it 's a religious holiday for us or not [ friday is a day of prayer in the muslim world ] because our religion does not prevent us from working to stop the bloodshed .
this is our priority , he told the guardian , speaking at a hotel on the edge of cairo where the delegation has stayed for the past week .

azzam al-ahmed , the head of the palestinian negotiating delegation in cairo , blamed israel for the breakdown in talks , saying its delegation had never given specific and clear answers to their demands , and who only communicated with through mediators .
the egyptian foreign ministry released a statement , however , which read : there was agreement on the majority of points but there remain a few very limited issues without a final decision .

israeli prime minister binyamin netanyahu friday morning ordered israel 's military to retaliate forcefully to the hamas breach of the ceasefire , an official said in a statement , and israeli army spokesman lieutenant colonel peter lerner said : we will continue to strike hamas , its infrastructure , its operatives and restore security for the state of israel .
at 8am we heard rocket sirens and took cover .
it 's quite depressing , yishai bider , an israeli man whose family lives near the border , explains in a video of his family watching rocket launches and taking cover .
he goes on to say , we want quiet , we want them to have quiet , we want to be their friends .
i believe there are many people who would like to live peacefully together .
israeli troops shot dead a palestinian during west bank protests , medical officials tell the afp .
they said that mohammed qatri , 19 , was one of a group who clashed with soldiers near the israeli settlement of psagot , between jerusalem and the west bank city of ramallah .
the army said it was looking into the report .
palestinian medical officials said that one man was seriously injured by a live shot to the chest , while another 29 received lesser wounds from a mixture of live fire and rubber bullets .
a spokeswoman clarified that riot dispersal means used on demonstrations include 0.22 calibre rifle fire .
palestinian protesters hurl stones at israeli soldiers during clashes at bet forik checkpoint .
badarneh/epa
state department spokesperson marie harf says and that the us team in cairo is assessing and advising if we can help , but is not directly mediating talks .
though the us team will remain in cairo , she says : we are not in direct contact with hamas , i can not be more clear about that .

she says hamas continues to make maximalist demands , but refuses to explain what she means by the phrase , deflecting a reporter 's questions by saying cairo talks are ongoing to make progress on that same problem .
harf reiterates the us line of hope for a return to a temporary ceasefire , from which the foundation for a lasting peace deal can develop .

asked about the israel 's decision to withdraw its delegation from talks , harf obliquely defends the choice : they faced a situation where they were ready to accept a ceasefire and hamas chose to start firing rockets ¦ i 'm not going to do an analysis about internal israeli political dynamics .

questioned about the high death toll of civilians and whether or not the us can do more to influence israel , she shows some impatience and defends : hamas is a huge security threat to israel and we have been very clear that we will help them fight that threat ¦ we have encouraged the israelis to take additional steps to protect civilians there .
israel and gaza militants resumed cross-border attacks after a three-day ceasefire expired .
more than 50 rockets have been fired towards israel today , according to the idf , which also says it has hit 47 targets in gaza since the strikes began again .
five gazans have been killed since attacks resumed , and 31 wounded .
the dead include at least one child , aged 10 , killed during a strike on the backyard of a mosque .
the un says that since the conflict began , 1,922 palestinians have died of whom 1,407 are believed to be civilians , including 448 children .
a rocket fired by militants in gaza hit the sdot negev regional council and injured a civilian moderately and a soldier lightly , according to israeli authorities .
sixty-seven israelis have been killed since the four-week war began , including three civilians .
talks in egypt stalled in an atmosphere of mutual recrimination ; a hamas spokesman said parties are not even close to a peace deal .
egypt , the un and us called on a return to the temporary ceasefire .
the israeli delegation left cairo and not indicated whether it will return .
protests around west bank cities and borders clashed violently with israeli forces , with one palestinian shot dead and dozens wounded .
hundreds of palestinians marched and threw rocks at border guards , who broke up the protest with riot dispersal means .
nearly 250,000 people have fled to un shelters in gaza , according to the un , and some 65,000 estimated homeless .

yesterday 's optimism for an end to the violence has been replaced with uncertainty and fear , reported the guardian 's jason burke : we are back into a very uncertain , dangerous situation , but what is the case is that the war has basically restarted .
israeli shells have landed in the areas of rafah , jabaliya , gaza city and khan younis since attacks resumed this morning , and hit 47 targets , according to the idf .
there are refugee camps near jabaliya and khan younis .

hamas has in turn fired 51 rockets and mortars at israel since 8am , haaretz reports , and sirens have sounded near hof ashkelon , be'er sheva , eshkol regional council and southern israel generally .
among the five palestinians killed in gaza since the ceasefire ended is at least one child , a 10-year-old , ap reports .
israeli forces also reportedly shot dead a palestinian at a violent protest in the west bank .

white house press secretary josh earnest reasserts the us line on the war in gaza , condemning hamas rocket attacks and saying , it 's our hope that the parties will agree to a ceasefire in the coming hours .
earnest says that the decision by hamas to resume firing rockets at israel puts palestinians at greater risk , [ and ] it will do nothing to meet the expectations of the palestinian people .
he says the us hopes a sustainable ceasefire is in the foreseeable future , and that americans are still involved in the cairo negotiations .
asked about whether hamas ' requests were n't reasonable , earnest says that 's a question to be resolved at the negotiating table .
we certainly do n't believe it was appropriate for hamas to restart rocket fire .

my colleagues raya jalabi , tom mccarthy and nadja popovich have written an in-depth piece about the six un school shelters hit by israeli strikes in the past four weeks , and on the casualties and details of those strikes .

israeli shells have struck schools housing thousands , twice targeting one building , and have also hit a playground near a shelter , which survivors say was crowded with families waiting to be ferried to safety [ when ] one shell landed in the schoolyard , followed by several more rounds that hit the upper storeys of the building .
a graphic from the close look at strikes on un schools in gaza .

photograph : /the guardian the piece includes maps , an accounting of the wounded and killed , circumstances of each strike , and statements by israeli authorities and un officials including the un 's increasingly voluble outrage .

un secretary general ban ki-moon has said there is nothing is more shameful than attacking sleeping children , and israeli officials insist that they are both investigating several incidents as well as neutralizing the targeted militants in some of them .
you can read the full piece here .

documents.title: protests erupt in the west bank
text: israeli troops wounded dozens of palestinians in the west bank city of hebron , palestinian medical officials tell afp .
they said that one man was seriously injured by a live shot to the chest , while another 29 received lesser wounds from a mixture of live fire and rubber bullets .
the army said that soldiers were attacked by about 300 violent protesters .
they rolled burning tyres and threw a fire bomb and rocks , a spokeswoman told afp in english .
the soldiers responded by firing riot disposal means , she added , without elaborating .
there were also protests in ramallah and near nablus , and on the edges of bethlehem israeli police said hundreds of protesters threw stones and ad hoc explosives .
they were also dispersed by border police .
palestinian protesters at west bank checkpoints have clashed with israeli guards there , as photos from alaa badarneh and abed omar qusini show .
according to reports , about 20 palestinians were wounded in the clash .
a palestinian protester hides from israeli soldiers at bet forik checkpoint near the west bank city of nablus .
badarneh/epa palestinian protesters hurl stones at bet forik checkpoint .
badarneh/epa a palestinian protester throws stones toward israeli troops .
omar qusini/reuters
israel has banned mass gatherings in tel aviv , jerusalem and areas within 50 miles of the gaza border , ap and afp report .
within 25 miles of gaza restrictions are stricter and prohibit gatherings of more than 500 people .
in southern israel , the army said kindergarten and summer camps could only operate if there was a bomb shelter nearby .
this is very frustrating , we thought it would be over , said dov hartuv , who has lived for decades in nahal oz kibbutz just east of the border with gaza .
this might just be for 12 or 24 hours before they return to the negotiating table .
meanwhile it ruined all our plans and frustrated all of us , especially the families with young children , he told afp .
about 65,000 palestinians are believed now to be homeless , the guardian 's jason burke ( @ burke jason ) reports from gaza city .
he spoke with a worker at a un school shelter .
un worker amal zaqqout said the school was now holding more displaced people than before the ceasefire .
we are very , very crowded .
we have 2,000 or more people living in corridors , in classrooms , everywhere .
thank god we have not had any transmissible diseases , but that is definitely a concern now , zaqqout said .
burke also spoke with several gazans , who told him of vacillating support for hamas ' demands and desperation for lasting peace .
before the ceasefire , more than a quarter of gaza 's 1.8 million people had been displaced .
the people 's demands are humanitarian .
even if the resistance agreed to drop the demands , the people would not agree .

we are at the point where life or death is the same thing for us , said mohamed eid , 40 , who has been living in the grounds of the main hospital in gaza since his house was destroyed in fierce fighting in the east of the city 15 days ago .
but faiza abu khalil , 37 , said she was very worried and very scared and still hoped for peace .
abu khalil had returned to gaza from her home near beit lahiya on thursday night when it appeared the ceasefire would not hold .
you can read the full piece here .
hamas may overplay its hand in cairo , analysts tell the afp , which has a report on the stalled negotiations and hamas ' demands to lift the israeli and egyptian blockade of gaza .
an open seaport has reportedly become a particularly contentious issue .
hamas sees lifting the blockade ¦ as the minimum it can take home to a war-battered gaza strip .
clearly they are not going to get it .
question is how much easing will they get ?
says nathan thrall , from the international crisis group .
any boat would be able to enter without being checked and israel will never accept that , warned thrall , pointing out that a port would simply give hamas a new means to smuggle in rockets .
naji charab , a political affairs expert at al-azhar university in gaza , says hamas is looking for some kind of compromise that would give it an honourable exit .
egypt has cracked down hard on its border with gaza , destroying tunnels and pressing hard on it and its ally , the muslim brotherhood , in egypt .

kobi michael , a political scientist at ariel university in the west bank tells afp that egypt has no problem seeing gazans buckle under the burden , israel , meanwhile , faces difficult questions of what it will do should hamas continue to fire rockets unabated , as it has done .
israel claims its objective of destroying terror tunnels has been largely successful .
israel did not want to go in , to conquer gaza , to progress too deep , said yoram schweitzer , a former counter-terrorism chief in the israeli military .
but if the conflict gets bogged down and the sides ca n't reach an acceptable agreement , israel would have to decide if it changes its policy and enters gaza for a wider operation , he said .
video released by the al-quds brigade , a gaza militant group associated with the islamic jihad faction , purports to show fighters in underground tunnels readying rockets to fire at israel .
the video , which was posted as the 72-hour ceasefire ended , then shows rockets firing into the sky , presumably toward israel .
un secretary general ban ki-moon has called for a return to a ceasefire agreement , afp reports .
he also condemned the firing of rockets from gaza .
the secretary general expressed his deep disappointment over the failure to extend the 72-hour truce that expired friday and said peace talks in cairo should continue .
ban condemns the renewed rocket fire towards israel .
more suffering and death of civilians caught up in this conflict is intolerable , said a statement from his spokesman .
ban firmly called on the palestinians and israel not to resort to further military action that can only exacerbate the already appalling humanitarian in gaza .

the un has assisted in brokering several ceasefires since the conflict began four weeks ago , including humanitarian truces that held to allow civilians in gaza to recover and an us-un coordinated ceasefire that broke down within hours .
egypt called for a return to ceasefire conditions friday as well , and a palestinian delegation is in cairo .
the gaza health ministry reports that since the end of the ceasefire friday morning , five palestinians have been killed and 31 injured .
un spokesman chris gunness says nearly a quarter of a million people are displaced and trying to find refuge in the rapidly refilling unrwa shelters :
sirens in beer sheva signal a barrage of rockets fired toward the israeli city , as well as in bedouin regions nearby .
haaretz reports that iron dome batteries intercepted two rockets and two hit open areas .
daniel nisman ( @ dannynis ) rockets fired toward city of beer sheva for the first time in nearly 4 days .
the rockets follow a series of israeli air strikes near al-qarara and north of khan younis in gaza , which have reportedly injured several palestinians and killed at least three .
the idf has carried out at least 35 air strikes since the ceasefire ended friday morning , according to a military spokesperson quoted by afp .
israel and gaza militants resumed cross-border attacks after a three-day ceasefire expired .
more than 45 rockets have been launched from gaza towards israel today , according to the idf , which reportedly attacked more than 40 targets in the coastal enclave .
a young palestinian boy , ibrahim aldawaseh .
was reportedly killed by an israeli strike on the backyard of a mosque .
there were conflicting reports suggesting he was aged either 10 or 12-years-old .
israel said a rocket fired by militants in gaza had hit the sdot negev regional council and injured a civilian moderately and a soldier lightly .
the hamas spokesman in gaza , sami al-zohri , said no peace deal was even close and that there had been no concessions on any of the palestinian demands .

azzam al-ahmed , the head of the united palestinian delegation in cairo , accused israel of failing to give specific and clear answers to their demands in gaza city , yesterday 's mood of optimism that the conflict was over has now been replaced with uncertainty and fear , reported the guardian 's jason burke .
he said : we are back into a very uncertain , dangerous situation , but what is the case is that the war has basically restarted .
here is more from my colleague jason burke in gaza : i have just been talking to sami al-zohri , the hamas spokesmen here .

he says no deal is even close , that there have been no concessions on any of the palestinian demands , from lifting the blockade through to prisoner releases , no progress on opening a seaport or airport etc .

he claims the only offer from the israeli side is to ease access through erez , the main border crossing , though he appeared unclear if that was simply an offer to return to the situation with erez before this most recent conflict or something more substantial .
zohri also said that , as far as he knew , there had been no discussions with the egyptians over some kind of opening of the rafah border between gaza and egypt .
no comment was his answer when asked if hamas has confidence in the egyptians .
however zohri did say that he believed a peaceful resolution was possible and that the palestinian delegation wanted talks to continue .
gaza city this evening seems remarkably relaxed given the situation .
though the streets are empty and shops are all closed , i saw kids playing football on waste ground for the first time and a few - a very few - people walking and talking outside their homes .
the egyptian foreign ministry has urged resumption of talks , claiming that there is agreement on the majority of the points .
but that seems far removed from the palestinian point of view jason burke ( @ burke jason ) hamas in # gaza say : no deal , no israeli concession , no peace .
asked if have confidence in egyptians ?
'no comment ' .
the un office for the coordination of humanitarian affairs ( unocha ) has released its latest gaza emergency situation report ( pdf link ) .

here are some of the main points : rescue teams have retrieved additional bodies , bringing the cumulative death toll of palestinians to 1,922 , of whom 1,407 are believed to be civilians , including 448 children ; the status of 297 fatalities remains to be determined .
10,000 of the estimated 46,000 pregnant women in gaza are displaced .
shifa hospital has reported a 15 % to 20 % increase in premature births .
explosive remnants of war are posing a major threat to civilians , particularly in the 3km-wide band , previously declared as a buffer zone .
palestinian families leave their homes in gaza city 's shuja'iya neighbourhood in fear of israeli attacks on 8 august 2014 .
amra/zuma press/corbis
the idf has posted video footage online of some of its strikes today , which it says were aimed at gazan terror sites .

stuart willcuts , director of the emergency response in gaza by ngo mercy corps , which says it has the largest humanitarian presence on the ground in the coastal enclave after the un , said hopes of some relief for people have been dashed by the ending of the truce : the 72-hour ceasefire gave us all hope that a more durable peace agreement was on the horizon .
yesterday , i watched families starting to move out of the displacement shelters and go back home .
there was a lot of hope yesterday that the ceasefire may hold .
today those hopes are dashed .
after nearly a month of intense fighting , the needs of the people are massive .
safe and secure humanitarian access to allow for distributions of food , water and other emergency assistance to the civilian population must be continued .
with the resumption of hostilities , the un relief and works agency says that palestinians are once more fleeing to its shelters .
chris gunness ( @ chrisgunness ) unrwa shelters in # gaza are filling up again : there are 221,554 displaced people in 89 unrwa schools rt

my colleague patrick kingsley has sent through this update from cairo on the prospects of peace talks ; the head of the united palestinian negotiation team in cairo , which contains members of all the major palestinian factions , says the team wants to continue negotiations , despite the outbreak of further violence in the gaza strip .

speaking at a hotel on the edge of cairo , where the delegation has stayed for the past week , azzam al-ahmed said that we will continue through our egyptian brothers to negotiate , to reach a final agreement that would return the rights [ of the palestinians ] .

he added : we 've notified the egyptians that we 're here , whether it 's a religious holiday for us or not [ friday is a day of prayer in the muslim world ] because our religion does not prevent us from working to stop the bloodshed .
this is our priority .

al-ahmed , a member of fatah , hamas 's longterm rival , blamed the breakdown of negotiations on israel , whose delegation he said had never gave specific and clear answers to their demands , and who only communicated with the palestinian through mediators in egyptian intelligence .
we have arrived a week ago as the palestinian delegation , said al-ahmed .
the israeli delegation arrived three days later .
they did not respect the time [ pressure ] , and [ the idea ] that we should take advantage of every minute to put an end to the destruction and the bloodshed of women and children in gaza .
al-ahmed said that even in the three days that the israeli delegation were here , they were only present for a few hours .
ahmed also stressed the unity of the palestinian delegation .
israeli and egyptian sources have claimed that ahmed threatened to quit negotiations because he did not approve of hamas 's demands .
but ahmed said the palestinians ' demands which mostly relate to the complete lifting of the blockade of gaza were agreed on by all the delegates .
in an apparent sign of the delegation 's unity , he and the hamas members of the delegation could be seen laughing together in a meeting in a hotel foyer before his statement .
haaretz , citing a senior idf source , reports that the israeli air force has attacked more than 40 targets since this morning .
the idf says that more than 45 rockets have been fired from gaza today .
idf ( @ idfspokesperson ) moments ago a rocket hit a civilian home in sderot .
no injures were yet reported .
since midnight gaza terrorists have fired over 45 rockets .
a palestinian man , who medics said was injured in an israeli airstrike , arrives at al-shifa hospital in gaza city , on 8 aug 2014 /rex

the guardian 's egypt correspondent , patrick kingsley , has been tweeting brief details of what the palestinian delegation in cairo have been saying : patrick kingsley ( @ patrickkingsley ) azzam al-ahmed , head of the pal negotiation team , now making a statement on # gaza patrick kingsley ( @ patrickkingsley ) azzam al-ahmed , head of pal delegation , says negotiations continue ; says israelis did n't present demands .
will meet egyptians again 2day .
patrick kingsley ( @ patrickkingsley ) azzam al-ahmed says the pal team is ready to stay a number of days in egypt to negotiate , but not indefinitely .
# gaza
egypt has urged a resumption of the gaza ceasefire to allow a return to negotiations , reuters is reporting , citing the country 's foreign ministry .
it says agreement was reached over most major issues in the talks , with only limited issues remaining unresolved .
jerusalem post reporter niv elis says israel is calling its reserve soldiers back .
niv elis ( @ telaniv ) reserves getting called back .
this looks like it 's going to get worse before it gets better .
journalists are reporting that the first death since the truce expired was that of a young boy called ibrahim aldawaseh .
there seems to be uncertainty over his age , with some saying he is 10 and others saying he is 12 .
a purporting to be of ibrahim 's body draped in a fatah flag is being shared on twitter ( warning : upsetting image ) .

mohamed yehia ( @ yeh1a ) 1st palestinian death since collapse of # gaza diplomatic efforts : 12 yr old ibrahim aldawawseh bel trew - ø¨ù øªø±ù ( @ beltrew ) saw photos of the 12-year-old ibrahim killed while playing in a mosque under construction.his skull was peeled open like a sardine tin # gaza
the associated press has posted video footage of today 's exchange of fire after the end of the ceasefire .
the associated press ( @ ap ) video : israel and gaza militants resume cross-border attacks after three-day truce expires :
a spokesman for the israeli prime minister binyamin netanyahu has tweeted : ofir gendelman ( @ ofirgendelman ) israel will not negotiate under fire .
israel will act to protect its citizens while making every effort not to harm civilians in gaza .
here 's a summary of today 's developments : israel and gaza militants resumed cross-border attacks after a three-day ceasefire expired .
more than 20 rockets were launched from gaza towards israel within four hours of the truce ending , prompting the israel defence force to carry out air strikes across the gaza strip .
unconfirmed reports citing palestinian officials claimed that a 10-year-old boy was killed by one israeli strike on the backyard of a mosque .
israel said a rocket fired by militants in gaza had hit the sdot negev regional council and injured a civilian moderately and a soldier lightly .
fighting resumed after egyptian-brokered talks in cairo expired at 8am local time ( 5am gmt ) .
a senior hamas official said earlier that the militant group would not extend the ceasefire , claiming that israel had rejected all of its demands .
the palestinians declared that an israeli-egyptian blockade of gaza must be lifted and about 100 prisoners held by israel freed to secure a further truce .
israel insisted that hamas must disarm , which officials from the palestinian group said on thursday was inconceivable .
in gaza city , yesterday 's mood of optimism that the conflict was over has now been replaced with uncertainty and fear , reported the guardian 's jason burke .
he said : we are back into a very uncertain , dangerous situation , but what is the case is that the war has basically restarted .
jason burke , the guardian 's correspondent in gaza , analyses the latest outbreak of fighting between israel and hamas : is what 's happening an extension of talks in cairo ?
is it part of a maneuvering ?
is it part of an attempt by hamas to get greater concession in cairo ?
or is it simply a rejection of the current talks ?
those are all questions that will become clearer as the hours pass .
one thing is for certain : this is a fast-moving situation and the questions that were relevant at 8 this morning may not be relevant at 8pm tonight .
we are back into a very uncertain , dangerous situation , but what is the case is that the war has basically restarted .
smoke rises over gaza city following an israeli airstrike in response to rocket fire /rex

here 's the latest from jason burke , our correspondent in gaza city , who reports that yesterday 's feeling of cautious optimism has given way to uncertainty and danger : last night it was fairly obvious there was a fair chance that the ceasefire would not be renewed but most people were optimistic that a renewal of hostilities would be avoided .
gaza yesterday was very lively shops were open , people were buying things they have n't been able to get for weeks it was almost back to normal .
there was a genuine sense this was over .
this morning people are very demoralised .
gaza city is very quiet .
there 's no-one on the streets , shops that had opened have now closed .
those who had been displaced by the fighting , many of them had gone back to their homes and have now had to return to the un shelters where they had been staying .
we 've got reports that about 20 rockets have gone out [ from gaza towards israel ] .
there have been audible explosions in gaza city , including one near the school where i was at .
there are reports of up to six or seven injured and possibly one person killed , a 10-year-old boy , althought that 's unconfirmed .
this map charts the cross-border rocket fire between israel and gaza since the ceasefire expired this morning :
the guardian 's jason burke was in gaza city when the israeli air strikes began : jason burke ( @ burke jason ) not a good morning .
audible strikes close to where i just was in # gaza city , poss rocket falling short .
refugees pouring back into schools .
my colleague frances perraudin has created this timeline of the conflict : timeline of the conflict

documents.title: two israelis injured by mortar shrapnel
text: two israelis , a civilian and a soldier , have been wounded by mortar shrapnel in sdot negev , reports haaretz .
earlier , two rockets fell in open areas in sdot negev with no reported injuries .
haaretz also reports that the cross-border fighting has causted disruption to flights to and from ben-gurion international airport .
at least 19 flights were delayed when israeli airspace was closed earlier this morning .

here 's the latest from associated press on the cross-border fighting in gaza : israel and gaza militants resumed cross-border attacks on friday , after a three-day truce expired and egyptian-brokered talks on a new border deal for blockaded gaza hit a deadlock .

it was not clear if the renewed fighting would derail the cairo talks aimed at reaching a sustainable truce , or whether the egyptian mediators can find a way to prevent a further escalation and a return to full-out war .
militants from gaza fired first , after the temporary truce expired at 8 a.m. ( 0500 gmt ) friday , launching 21 rockets toward israel .
most landed it open fields , but two were intercepted over the coastal city of ashkelon .
the israeli military said it responded with strikes across gaza .
gaza police said an israeli airstrike hit in the area of a housing project in northern gaza and that there were reports of casualties .
another strike hit a farm south of gaza city , they said .
police also reported fire from israeli tanks on northern gaza and from israeli gunboats at the central area of the territory .
al-jazeera 's bureau in gaza reports that an israeli air strike has hit an empty field in sheikh ijlin neighbourhood in west gaza .
another strike was carried out in the north .
no casualties are reported .
the sky is busy with israeli drones and war jets , according to al-jazeera .
ruth pollard , of the sydney morning herald , tweets : ruth pollard ( @ rpollard ) big boom in # gaza city , reports that residents in shajaiyah are running for schools as air strikes begin again .
meanwhile in israel , sirens are reportedly sounding in sderot and the shaar hanegev region , both close to the gaza border .
the iron dome is reported to have downed one missile fired from gaza towards shaar hanegev .

documents.title: idf confirms retaliatory strikes on gaza
text: the israel defence force has confirmed it has renewed strikes on gaza : idf ( @ idfspokesperson ) in response to the renewal of rocket fire by gaza terrorists at israel , we are striking terror sites in gaza .
the strikes , which included one reported major explosion in gaza city , follow the firing of at least 18 rockets into israel following the end of the ceasefire nearly four hours ago .

documents.title: israel orders response to gaza rockets
text: now haaretz is reporting that israeli prime minister binyamin netanyahu has ordered retaliatory strikes on gaza : barak ravid ( @ barakravid ) breaking : israeli official : pm netanyahu & mod yaalon ordered idf to retaliate strongly to hamas 's violation of the ceasefire in gaza

documents.title: reports of explosion in gaza city
text: cnn 's matthew chance is reporting an explosion in gaza city the first since the ceasefire ended three and a half hours ago .

matthew chance ( @ mchancecnn ) # breaking first large explosion in gaza city israeli fighter jet over head # cnn and ruth pollard , of the sydney morning herald , reports that the israeli military has been given the green light to respond to rockets fired from gaza : ruth pollard ( @ rpollard ) after 2.5 hours of rocket fire , local israeli media reporting # israel has given order to respond .
lots of drones in the sky , f16s too .
according to haaretz , israel 's economy minister naftali bennett has called for a firm response to the rockets fired from gaza since the temporary truce expired .
he was quoted by the israeli news outlet : firing on israeli citizens as a way of exerting pressure is a test of israeli deterrence for years to come .
the response must be firm .
i remind the israeli public that operation protective edge has not yet ended and hamas has not been defeated .
israelis must be strong and prepared for what is to come .
here is the latest story from my colleagues jason burke in gaza and patrick kingsley in cairo .
they write : at least 10 rockets have been fired from gaza towards israel after hamas refused to extend a 72-hour ceasefire that expired at 8am local time on friday .
israel said it had made no response to multiple attacks .
at least one rocket appeared to have fallen short , landing in gaza itself .
it was unclear whether hamas or the independent but allied group palestinian islamic jihad was responsible for launching the rockets .
hamas officials in gaza on thursday threatened to restart hostilities if their demands were not met in indirect negotiations with israel that have continued in cairo for most of the week .
as friday dawned there was no word of progress .

documents.title: more than 18 rockets fired from gaza , israel says
text: more than 18 rockets have been fired from gaza towards israel since the ceasefire expired at 8am local time ( 5am gmt ) , the israel defence force says .
idf ( @ idfspokesperson ) since 8:00 , over 18 rockets were fired from gaza at israel .
2 were intercepted above ashkelon , 14 hit open areas & 2 landed in gaza .
my colleagues jason burke in gaza and patrick kingsley in cairo wrote this detailed piece on the ceasefire talks before the rocket fire resumed on friday morning .
hamas officials in gaza were standing firm on their demands and threatening to restart hostilities as the 72-hour ceasefire with israel expired on friday morning .
the palestinians declared that an israeli-egyptian blockade of gaza must be lifted and about 100 prisoners held by israel freed to secure a further truce .
israel insisted that hamas must disarm , which officials from the palestinian group said on thursday was inconceivable .
one member of the palestinian negotiating team in cairo was quoted as saying : if the israelis do n't agree we will go back and fight through the tunnels .
the declaration raises the prospect of a further bout of fighting in a conflict in which nearly 1,900 palestinians , most of them civilians , have died along with 64 israeli soldiers .
in jerusalem , israel 's government spokesman mark regev has blamed gaza militants for breaking the ceasefire .
the ceasefire is over , he said .
they did that .
according to the associated press , regev would not say whether israel was interested in extending the ceasefire , or whether israel would respond to the rockets .
good morning .
at least 10 rockets have been fired from gaza towards israel after hamas refused to extend a 72-hour ceasefire that expired at 8am local time ( 5am gmt ) on friday .
israeli officials said there had been no response to multiple attacks .
at least one rocket appeared to have fallen short , landing in gaza itself .
a senior hamas official said earlier that the militant group would not extend the ceasefire , claiming that israel had rejected all of its demands in egyptian-brokered talks .

bulletin.text: Israel strikes Gaza after militants' rockets end ceasefire.
Protests turn violent in West Bank cities, killing one.
One 10-year-old boy killed as attacks resume.
Palestinians flee homes to return to crowded UN schools.
Hamas says peace deal is not even close as Cairo talks stall.
